title.rendered: Karnataka vs Uttarakhand, Indian First-Class Trophy 2022: Today’s Match Preview, Fantasy Cricket Tips

content.rendered:
We have opted for a fantasy cricket team based on the recent performances, overall impact, and credit points.

Probable XIs

Karnataka: Ravikumar Samarth, Mayank Agarwal (c), Devdutt Padikkal, Manish Pandey, Nikin Jose, Sharath BR (wk), Shubhang Hegde, Krishnappa Gowtham, Vasuki Koushik/Vijaykumar Vyshak, Shreyas Gopal, Vidhwath Kaverappa

Uttarakhand: Aditya Tare (c & wk), Kunal Chandela, Akhil Rawat, Avneesh Sudha, Swapnil Singh, Aryan Sharma, Abhay Negi, Priyanshu Khanduri , Mayank Mishra, Agrim Tiwari, Nikhil Kohli

Pitch Report

Venue: M.Chinnaswamy Stadium, Bengaluru

(Based on the last 3 games)

1st innings average score: 306

2nd innings average score: 266

3rd innings average score: 186

4th innings average score: 137

Wickets per innings: 8

Type: Balanced

Wins

Batting 1st: —

Batting 2nd: 67%

Fantasy Tips of the Day

Mayank Agarwal averages a whopping 51 at his home ground: he has accumulated 922 runs including two hundreds and five fifties. He is also Karnataka’s top run-scorer of the season: 603 runs at 67.

For Uttarakhand, Kunal Chandela has done the majority of the scoring. His 509 runs include a hundred and three fifties.

Ravikumar Samarth has scored consecutive hundreds in Bengaluru, and in the process, completed 1,000 runs at the venue.

Shreyas Gopal and Krishnappa Gowtham have pushed themselves to the Ultimate Team in the last three games. Between them this season, they have scored 302 runs and taken 35 wickets.

The bowlers for this game have incredible numbers at their disposal. While Mayank Mishra (32 wickets) has hunted down the bulk of the wickets for Uttarakhand, Vidhwath Kaverappa (21 wickets) and Vijaykumar Vyshak (27 wickets) have been bowling well in tandem.

In the last three games at the venue, five hundreds have been scored – all of which came in the first and second innings.

The bounce in the wicket has helped spinners as much as it did to pacers. While two of three five-fors belonged to fast bowlers, the best bowling figures of 6 for 60 belonged to a spinner.
